summary: Filmmaker Andrew Rossi examines the rising phenomenon of fake news and how it impacts the average citizen in the United States.

reviews.content: Although this information is incredibly and increasingly troubling- it needs to be discussed and squashed.  The worst offenders should be jailed and silenced.

There are people who think that playing around with conspiracy theories is fun. Playing with reality. Pretending there's a plot in every dark corner. Even if they don't actually believe it, they don't realize that they help hold the door open for much darker and more dangerous things. And that they contribute to the collective intellectual erosion of our country. This shows a few of the ways that false information can be used as a deadly weapon.

I was in the middle on this documentary. At one point it does give a good Insight on the horrible and really negative aspects of Fringe group conspiracies and falsities , as well as Internet groups that inflamed the issue of misinformation. The clear aspects of misinformation they failed to touch on and completely ignored was actually "trustworthy" News Network and spins which was quite disappointing. But it covers the fringe side ok
It's a well crafted piece that juxtaposes the fact that fake news exists, while sublimley elevating the Trump-Russia collussion narrative as fact, when we all know it was rubbish.
Total propaganda. The "journalist" who starred in this rhetoric work for the biggest perpetrators of fake news. Save your time and educate yourself. Fake news is on mainstream media all the time.
It's basically lamestream narratives just saying things aren't true & we're just supposed to take them at their word.....after years of gaslighting us
Talk about disinformation....
The kind of documentary we all should see.
Fake news exposed. What a weird world Americans now live in.

I realize the impact that intentional false stories have on the public's perception of important issues, but this also highlights the very real and devastating impact these stories have on people's lives. 
It also made me dislike Zuckerberg even more. His deliberate ignorance is infuriating.

clearly biased garbage.  If you think the media is bad, well this show will show you, you are wrong.  Unless you watch conservative news like Fox. Then you are wrong.  According this show, CNN and the New York Times are perfect. If you have any doubts about my review, just look at the fact that Brian Stelter the front man for reidiculous CNN HOKEY nonsense is one of the producers.  
I would say if you sit on the left, sit back and enjoy hearing what you already knew.  If your on the right, sit back and be outraged. 
If you want the truth, you will not find it here.

This is something that every American should watch.  It details the beginning of what I as a veteran see as what will destroy our nation faster than anything else.  It puts a face to a faceless enemy... misinformation.

One sided left-wing propaganda garbage.  Yes, Pizzagate was a conspiracy, but what about the Russian collusion story that rang for three straight years that was the mother of all fake news, and they knew it was fake?

It's one of the best documentary films I have ever seen. The assault on truth in the US and around the world has never been greater. This film helps explain the process ... and the hope for our future. Important and so worthwhile.
Shows the dangers of conspiracy theorists and other people who intentionally spread misinformation.  Beware of Infowars, 4Chan, & reddit conspiracy groups.
Should not have watched this, just adds to my anxiety. Not sure it really added anything to the conversation other than revisiting all the horrible people and examples, which I didn't need to do.

Slanted left view of the issue - Brian Stelter of CNN helped make it if you watch the credits. 

Could have been so much better if it was not so one sided. Maybe people would be less tribal with wider coverage the issues.
Eye opening and disturbing.
Its bullshit-this is to only make liberal media look good.  Its propaganda for sure.
One sided liberal view of a serious issue. Not worth ones time.

Unfortunately this just felt like an hour long procession of voices that I have spent 4 years avoiding. It just didn't attack the problem as much as I was hoping. I just felt like more of a cable news special than a hard hitting HBO documentary. Disappointed because this is such an incredibly important problem. If you are looking for a more in-depth look into the world of misinformation I would recommend 'The Great Hack" on Netflix.

This topic needs to be brought to light, this was a attempt but a one sided one. Does nothing more than show real examples but from only one side which in the long run feeds the distrust of media. Maybe one day documentaians will give honest perspective but this is not that day.
